Package controller

Class MainViewController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainViewController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainViewController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This controller class manages the data flow and operations associated with the Main View defined by mainView.fxml.

  • Method Details

    • onAddNewAppointment

      void onAddNewAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This event handler method redirects the user to the Add Appointment view defined by AddModifyAppointment.fxml when the Add Appointment button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for the Add Appointment button to be clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onAddNewCustomer

      void onAddNewCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This event handler method redirects the user to the Add Customer view defined by AddModifyCustomer.fxml, when the Add Customer button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for the Add Customer button to be clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onDeleteAppointment

      void onDeleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This event handler method deletes the appointment that has been selected by the user in the appointment table view. If no appointment is selected, an exception is thrown. This triggers an alert prompting the user to select an appointment before clicking delete.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for Delete Appointment button to be clicked.

    • onDeleteCustomer

      void onDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This event handler method deletes the Customer that has been selected by the user in the customer table view. The method will also delete any appointments associated with that customer. If no customer is selected, an exception is thrown. This triggers an alert prompting the user to select a customer before clicking delete.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for Delete Customer button to be clicked.

    • onSelectAllRadio

      void onSelectAllRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method populates the Appointment Table view with all appointments in the database when clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for the All radio button to be toggled.

    • onSelectAppointmentReport

      void onSelectAppointmentReport(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method redirects users to the Reports view defined by Reports.fxml.
      Parameters:
      event - listen for click of reports button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onSelectExit

      void onSelectExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method allows users to exit the program.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for click of the exit button.

    • onSelectMonthRadio

      void onSelectMonthRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      LAMBDA USE: This method uses a lambda expression on a FilteredList to return a filtered list of Appointments that occur during the current calendar month. This approach requires fewer lines of code than would be required to achieve the same result with a loop and conditional statements. This method populates the Appointment Table with all appointments scheduled for the current calendar month.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for toggle of Month radio button.

    • onSelectWeekRadio

      void onSelectWeekRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      LAMBDA USE: This method uses a lambda expression on a FilteredList to return a filtered list of Appointments that occur within the following week of the current day. This approach requires fewer lines of code than would be required to achieve the same result with a loop and conditional statements. This method populates the Appointment Table with all appointments scheduled within 1 week of the current day.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for toggle of Month radio button.

    • onUpdateAppointment

      void onUpdateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method redirects users to the Update Appointment view defined by AddModifyAppointment.fxml.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for click of the Update Appointment button.

    • onUpdateCustomer

      void onUpdateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method redirects users to the Update Appointment view defined by AddModifyCustomer.fxml.
      Parameters:
      event - listens for click of the Update Customer button.

    • returnToMain

      public void returnToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method was created to reduce code-repetition in the AddModifyCustomer viewsand AddModifyAppointment views. It can be called from those methods to return a user to the main view. This method also provides a generic warning that the user will lose any unsaved input if they cancel and return to main view.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • checkAppointmentTimes

      public static void checkAppointmentTimes()
      This method is called on login to check if there are any appointments scheduled within 15 minutes of login tinme.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This initialize method populates the Customer Table and the Appointment Table with all current customers and appointments in the database.
